DataElement.preferredDefinition: Modified rankin scale (description of a six point scale that qualifies a person's physical abilities following a cerebrovascular accident) score.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Description of a six point scale that qualifies a person's physical abilities following a cerebrovascular accident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A six point scale that qualifies a person's physical abilities following a cerebrovascular accident.  It is commonly used as a primary endpoint in stroke treatment studies.

Concepts.definition: A six point scale that qualifies a person's physical abilities following a cerebrovascular accident. It is commonly used as a primary endpoint in stroke treatment studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: NINDS:National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke Common Data Element Project
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/25/18 - smt CDE transferred to NCIP ownership per NINDS (Muniza Sheikh) request.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Description of a six point scale that qualifies a person's physical abilities following a cerebrovascular accident.

Concepts.definition: The cessation of life.

PermissibleValues.value: 3 = Moderate disability; requiring some help, but able to walk without assistance

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

PermissibleValues.value: 4 = Moderately severe disability; bedridden, incontinent and requiring constant nursing care and attention

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.: Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

PermissibleValues.value: 1 = No significant disability despite symptoms; able to carry out all usual duties and activities

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.: Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

PermissibleValues.value: 2 = Slight disability; unable to carry out all previous activies, but able to look after  own affairs without assistance

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.: Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

PermissibleValues.value: 5 = Severe disability; bedridden, incontinent and requiring constant nursing care and attention

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.: Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
The words of something written.
